snippet: Even in our polarized political climate, many people might agree on the adoption of what economists call Pigovian taxes — levies on activities that have harmful side effects.
abstract: Robert H Frank Economic View column posits that even in our polarized political climate, many people might agree on adopting what economists call Pigovian taxes--levies on activities that have harmful side effects; holds that it should be easy for Pres Obama to persuade rational voters to embrace Pigovian taxes, but he must also persuade House Republicans.
lead_paragraph: Even in our polarized political climate, many people might agree on the adoption of what economists call Pigovian taxes — levies on activities that have harmful side effects.

headline.print_headline: Heads, You Win. Tails, You Win, Too.
headline.seo: Pigovian Taxes May Offer Economic Hope
